intro: Sida waltheriifolia, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and palmately lobed leaves. Sida waltheriifolia is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in arid environments due to its drought-tolerant nature. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant ecology.
